poem:
Title: "In the Market of Influence"

The rich narcotics of power,
Petrified fossils finance Farage,
The ship keeps sailing in a stagnant sea.
Horns of climate scepticism trumpet,
corroding the clarity of our shared truth.

A dance of deception,
at £200,000 a turn,
Leaning into the howling,
Silent as ice caps melt.
Each crack echoing complicity,
Each drop, a tear of the world.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who are the wealthy climate sceptics funding rightwing UK politics? A number of wealthy climate sceptics are giving funding to Nigel Farage’s Reform UK, rightwing Conservatives, and the climate science-denying thinktank the Global Warming Policy Foundation. But who are they and how are they linked? The biggest donor to the Reform party this year is the shipping magnate Terence Mordaunt, the head of First Corporate Shipping. His personal company, Corporate Consultants Ltd, has given £200,000". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
